moves.1. Nc3 Nc6 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Ne5 Ne4 4. Nxc6: Now my bishop is free, I unleash it, attacking the pawn that is not covered...
moves.12... Bxe3 13. fxe3: ...and we swap distorting my pawn structure, and I'm eyeing up his f-pawn again...
moves.14. d4 exd4 15. exd4: ...and we swap pawns, undistorting my structure.
moves.15... c5 16. dxc5 dxc5: We again swap pawns, creating more space on the board.
moves.17. Rf2: Now my rook comes up, to get more room to manoeuvre...
moves.17... h5 18. Rd2+: ...and attacks the king, forcing him to move.
moves.18... Ke7 19. Ke2 a6 20. Rf1: Now I unleash my other rook...
moves.21... Ra7: ...so he moves it out of the way.
moves.26... Bb7: This move actually played into my hands...
moves.27. Rc7+: ...as I simultaneously attack the bishop, and the king...
moves.27... Rd7: ...and blocking with his rook did likewise...
moves.29. Bxb7+: ...allowing me to remove his bishop, exposing his king to my rook.
moves.29... Ke7 30. Bc6: Now I eye up his pawn...
moves.31... Ke6 32. Rd5 Ra2+ 33. Rd2: I can afford to block, with an advantage of a bishop...
moves.33... Rxd2+ 34. Kxd2: ...so I get the exchange I was looking for.
moves.36. Bc6+: ...so I cover my g-pawn, attacking the king.
moves.36... Kd4 37. b4 Kc4 38. b5: Now my b-pawn and bishop can't be touched...
moves.38... Kc5 39. Ke3: ...so I bring my king to attack his pawns.
moves.42... f4: ...and he pushes his other pressurised pawn...
moves.43. Ke4: ...so I keep my king close by...
moves.46... Kc5 47. Kf6 Kd6 48. Kf7: ...and mine now has a clear run...
moves.48... Ke5 49. g5 Kf5 50. g6 Kg5 51. g7: ...so I push it all the way.

gameName: No queens or knights... how will you do? III
